citation.article-title: Oceanicola granulosus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Oceanicola batsensis sp. nov., poly-beta-hydroxybutyrate-producing marine bacteria in the order 'Rhodobacterales'
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Oceanicola (o.ce.a.ni′co.la. L. n. oceanus the ocean; L. masc. suffix -cola inhabitant; N.L. masc. n. Oceanicola inhabitant of the ocean).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile short rods that multiply by binary fission.
Neither flagella nor endospores were observed.
Faint yellowish colonies are formed on marine agar.
Metabolism is chemoheterotrophic and obligately aerobic to microaerotolerant.
Denitrification, arginine and gelatin hydrolysis, indole production and glucose acidification were negative.
Predominant fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c, 16 : 0 and cyclo 19 : 0.
The G+C content of genomic DNA is 67·3–71·5 mol% (by HPLC).
Phylogenetically, the genus forms a distinct clade within the order ‘Rhodobacterales’.
The genus contains two species, Oceanicola granulosus sp. nov. and Oceanicola batsensis sp. nov.
The type species of the genus is Oceanicola granulosus.
